text: I'm gonna make a red velvet cake today
but instead of red velvet I'm gonna
actually make it orange velvet or rather
an orange in yellow we velvet
to begin we need to mix our sugar our
butter our vegetable oil and of course
our vanilla into our mixing bowl and
we're gonna put it on our mixer with a
paddle attachment and then we're going
to mix our dry ingredients together so
that they're ready to go we have flour
we have cocoa and salt just whisk these
together and then we can crack our eggs
so that they're ready to add to the
batter we're going to begin by creaming
our butter and sugar until light and
fluffy about five minutes and when
that's done we'll begin to add our eggs
now that the eggs are incorporated we're
going to scrape down the batter one more
time and we're going to add our orange
food coloring
I wanted the batter to be orange but not
quite Halloween orange more like a
cheesy orange that's why there's
actually a bit of cocoa in the batter to
just sort of dull the color a little now
we're going to alternate our dry
ingredients which are flour cocoa and
salt with our wet ingredient which is
buttermilk we're going to start with dry
and then wet as always and I'm going to
do the dry in four parts and the wet in
three parts
once we've added all the dry ingredients
and the buttermilk we're going to scrape
down the bowl again this is important
just so that the batter isn't uneven now
we're going to add our final two
ingredients which are cider vinegar and
baking soda we're going to dump the
baking soda in and watch it foam up like
that science experiment you did with
volcanoes in elementary school and now
we add this to our batter get it all in
and turn our batter on one last time I
like to turn it up a bit higher and give
it one final good feeding so now our
cheesy
orange batter is ready it'll look like
cheese it won't taste we're ready to pop
our orange velvet cake into the oven at
350 for about 45 minutes or until a
toothpick inserted in the center comes
out
don't forget to subscribe to this
channel
